title: No access to Linkbox files and dirs
body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
n/a


#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Rclone successfully encodes and copies dirs and files to Linkbox, but then no way to sync or list or download it.

The problem is that Linkbox allows files and folders with names of up to 100 characters. But the search in their API works with names of up to 50 ASCII characters and 25 UTF-16 characters (for example, Cyrillic) only. Thus, normal operation is possible only with very short names. For example, using base32 encoding for names, the maximum name length can be only 8 UTF-16 characters, and for base32768 - 16 UTF-16 characters. Which is, of course, very little in real life.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.65.0 and rclone v1.66.0-beta.7594.5fa13e3e3


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Arch Linux 64 bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Linkbox


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`./rclone ls -vv "telebox-encoded:photos from London"`


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
<7>DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.65.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "-vv" "telebox-encoded:photos from London"]
<7>DEBUG : rclone: systemd logging support activated
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "telebox-encoded:photos from London"
<7>DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
<7>DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "telebox:files/encoded/347ftlbc73000l927l7hbud1i77qle7j8pfi9j01c5lu0bve5k8g"
<3>ERROR : : error listing: directory not found
<7>DEBUG : 5 go routines active
Failed to ls with 2 errors: last error was: directory not found
```



<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.
